guide.introduction: I'll show you how to create a charging station that fits right in with your other plants.
guide.introduction_rendered:
I'll show you how to create a charging station that fits right in with your other plants.

Tools
  • A pair of scissors.
  • Small saw file or Dremel rotary tool

lines.text: Gather your materials:
lines.text_raw: Gather your materials:

lines.text: Basic flower pot
lines.text_raw: Basic flower pot

lines.text: Charging cable
lines.text_raw: Charging cable

lines.text: 2 cups of potting soil
lines.text_raw: 2 cups of potting soil

lines.text: Toilet paper cardboard tube
lines.text_raw: Toilet paper cardboard tube

lines.text: Mounting squares
lines.text_raw: Mounting squares

lines.text: MiniDV cassette CASE only - no need for the tape.
lines.text_raw: MiniDV cassette CASE only - no need for the tape.

lines.text: Rubber band (optional)
lines.text_raw: Rubber band (optional)

lines.text: Thread your iPhone cable or other charger through the hole in the bottom of the pot. This photo shows the wrong end sticking out, but you get the idea.
lines.text_raw: Thread your iPhone cable or other charger through the hole in the bottom of the pot. This photo shows the wrong end sticking out, but you get the idea.

lines.text: Use the pair of scissors to cut four half-inch slices into the cardboard toilet paper tube.
lines.text_raw: Use the pair of scissors to cut four half-inch slices into the cardboard toilet paper tube.

lines.text: Thread the charger cable up the cardboard tube (this will protect it from the dirt).
lines.text_raw: Thread the charger cable up the cardboard tube (this will protect it from the dirt).

lines.text: Splay the cardboard tabs you cut (this will provide additional balance).
lines.text_raw: Splay the cardboard tabs you cut (this will provide additional balance).

lines.text: Stick two mounting squares (or similar padding) to the bottom of the pot. This will raise the pot enough to provide clearance for the charging cable to exit the bottom of the pot.
lines.text_raw: Stick two mounting squares (or similar padding) to the bottom of the pot. This will raise the pot enough to provide clearance for the charging cable to exit the bottom of the pot.

lines.text: Open the miniDV cassette case and use your rotary tool to drill a slit the length and width of your charger cable's wide end (1 inch if it's an iPhone charging cable). A hole of the exact width will ensure a snug fit, but it will work either way.
lines.text_raw: Open the miniDV cassette case and use your rotary tool to drill a slit the length and width of your charger cable's wide end (1 inch if it's an iPhone charging cable). A hole of the exact width will ensure a snug fit, but it will work either way.

lines.text: Use a spoon to fill the pot in with soil around the cardboard tube. Fill until the soil is level with the top of the cardboard tube, but not overflowing into it. You want a flat, level surface.
lines.text_raw: Use a spoon to fill the pot in with soil around the cardboard tube. Fill until the soil is level with the top of the cardboard tube, but not overflowing into it. You want a flat, level surface.

lines.text: I also added wedding invitation seed paper to the mix, but just dirt will work splendidly.
lines.text_raw: I also added wedding invitation seed paper to the mix, but just dirt will work splendidly.

lines.text: Wrap a rubber band around the charger end if you'd like a perfect, rubberized fit with the hole you drilled.
lines.text_raw: Wrap a rubber band around the charger end if you'd like a perfect, rubberized fit with the hole you drilled.

lines.text: Insert the charger into the cassette case and attach your iPhone.
lines.text_raw: Insert the charger into the cassette case and attach your iPhone.

lines.text: The case will act as a natural stand and is about the perfect width for the iPhone. If the soil is level with the tube, the case will support the weight of the iPhone without any problem.
lines.text_raw: The case will act as a natural stand and is about the perfect width for the iPhone. If the soil is level with the tube, the case will support the weight of the iPhone without any problem.

lines.text: Set your lock screen to a nice photo of a flower and add to your desk or garden!
lines.text_raw: Set your lock screen to a nice photo of a flower and add to your desk or garden!

guide.summary: Repurpose basic garden supplies to build a more organic cellphone charging station. Looks great on your desk.
